articles.title: Vice-Chairman of C.C., WPK Meets Mongolian Delegation
articles.content:
Vice-Chairman of C.C., WPK Meets Mongolian Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Thursday had a talk with the visiting delegation of the Mongolian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade led by Vice-Minister B. Battsetseg.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Meets Mongolian Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Meets Mongolian Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minster Ri Yong Ho Thursday had a talk with the delegation of the Mongolian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade led by Vice-Minister B. Battsetseg, which paid a courtesy call on him. 
					 Ri Yong Ho said President Kim Il Sung visited Mongolia twice and performed undying exploits for development of the relations of friendship between the two countries. He expressed expectation that the friendly relations with a long history and tradition would steadily develop through generations no matter how the international situation may change.
					
					 B. Battsetseg expressed the will to make positive efforts to continuously develop the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation provided by the preceding leaders of the two countries.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Mongolian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade led by Vice-Minister B. Battsetseg visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the stories of the old home, the guests looked round the historic relics preserved there.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Sci-Tech Complex, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, etc.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Director Meets Swedish State Secretary for Foreign Affairs
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Director Meets Swedish State Secretary for Foreign Affairs
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Son Gyong, director of the Department of European Affairs No. 2 of the DPRK Foreign Ministry, met and had a talk with Annika Soder, Swedish state secretary for Foreign Affairs, in Stockholm on May 16.
					 The DPRK side informed the opposite side of its principled stand to further develop the relations between the two countries and stressed that the U.S. nuclear threat and hostile policy towards the DPRK should be put to a definite end to ease tensions on the Korean peninsula and ensure peace and stability in the region.
					
					 The Swedish side said that Sweden has made steady efforts to make contribution to the development of the long-standing relations with the DPRK and guarantee of peace and security on the peninsula, and expressed its stand to continue to make efforts for the development of the bilateral relations.
					
					 Expressing deep concern over the situation of the Korean peninsula getting extremely strained, it said the peaceful settlement through dialogue would be the only way for reducing the tension.

articles.title: Throwing Overboard Pro-U.S. and Pro-Conservative Forces Called for
articles.content:
Throwing Overboard Pro-U.S. and Pro-Conservative Forces Called for
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A spokesman of the Consultative Council for National Reconciliation issued a statement Thursday, 37 years since the Kwangju popular uprising in south Korea.
					 The uprising was a popular armed uprising and a resistance for democracy against the U.S. and fascism in which the people stood against tyrannical forces in demand of independence and democracy of society and Korea's reunification against the colonial military fascist dictatorship by the U.S. and its stooges, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 It is the unanimous wish of the Kwangju uprisers to end the U.S. imperialists' colonial rule that has lasted century after century and throw overboard the pro-U.S. traitorous forces.
					
					 The south Koreans from all walks of life should wage courageous actions to eliminate the group of pro-U.S. fascists keen on sycophancy, treachery, dictatorship and murder with the same valiant fighting spirit with which they sentenced the Park Geun Hye group of traitors to shameful ruin by holding high the candlelight of justice.
					
					 Murderers like traitor Chun Doo Hwan keen on covering up the truth of Kwangju massacre and prolonging their dirty remaining days have to be hanged, being judged by the people, and the remnants of Park Geun Hye making last-ditch efforts to prevent the wheel of history from rolling toward independence, democracy and reunification have to be definitely thrown overboard.
					
					 Unless the U.S. colonial domination and rule are put to an end, the south Koreans' misfortune and pain will further and the desire wished by the Kwangju resistance fighters can never come true.
					
					 The south Koreans should vigorously turn out in the nationwide sacred war to drive the U.S. imperialist aggressors out of south Korea and carve out their own destiny with their own efforts under the uplifted banner of independence against the U.S.
					
					 South Koreans of all social standings including workers, peasants, youths and students have to hold higher the banner of independence, democracy and reunification that was held by the Kwangju resistance fighters and wage an unflinching struggle for independence against the U.S. and conservatives.

articles.title: Those Faulting DPRK's Measure for Self-Defence Will Not Be Pardoned: KAPPC
articles.content:
Those Faulting DPRK's Measure for Self-Defence Will Not Be Pardoned: KAPPC
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee (KAPPC) in a statement Thursday said the big success in the test-fire of ground-to-ground medium to long-range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 was a great national event that declared the birth of another perfect weaponry system, "Juche weapon" that would bring about the final victory after putting an end to the stand-off with the U.S. imperialists that has lasted for decades.
					 But the hostile forces including the U.S. are misleading the nature for preserving peace and the historic meaning of the test-fire and kicking up a roar, saying the test constitutes a "serious challenge to world peace and stability" and a "violation", the statement said, and went on:
					
					 What is all the astonishing is that the new south Korean authorities convened an emergency "state security council" with the involvement of even the remnants of Park Geun Hye group soon after the report about the rocket test-fire by the DPRK, where they published a "statement" denouncing the test-fire, while calling it "violation of the UN resolution", "serious challenge" and "test on the new government".
					
					 The DPRK's measures for bolstering its capabilities for self-defence is a crucial issue on which hinges the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the destiny of the nation. It is not an issue which can be stopped or slowed down with the replacement of administration in the U.S. and the emergence of "the new regime" in south Korea.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, as long as the U.S. increases its hostile policy toward the DPRK and the threat of a nuclear war, the DPRK's capabilities for making nuclear retaliatory blow for self-defence for reliably defending the peace on the Korean peninsula and the region will increase at higher pace.
					
					 The U.S. is threatening and blackmailing the DPRK, while talking about "pressure" but the American style bluffing by which it reduces only non-nuclear states and weak nations into the plaything of its military action can never work on the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have to draw a serious lesson from the wretched fate of traitor Park Geun Hye who met a miserable end while vociferating about "nuclear threat from the north" and going keen on hurting the fellow countrymen with the help of outsiders that only think of inflicting nuclear disaster on the nation.
					
					 Those who challenge the dignity and social system of the DPRK while faulting the DPRK's legitimate measure for bolstering the nuclear force for self-defence should not expect any mercy.

articles.title: DPRK Government Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Government Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation led by Kim Yong Jae, minister of External Economic Relations, returned home Thursday after attending the Belt and Road Forum for International Cooperation held in China.

articles.title: Developers of Rocket Hwasong-12 Arrive Here
articles.content:
Developers of Rocket Hwasong-12 Arrive Here
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Developers of the ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 arrived here on Thursday. 
					 Streets of the capital city of Pyongyang were full of festive atmosphere to greet the scientists of national defence.
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of people from all walks of life and school youth and children were waiting for the merited persons along the streets from the plaza of the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium, Mansudae Street, Changjon Crossroads, University Street, etc.
					
					 The developers were greeted at the plaza of the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium by Ri Man Gon, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned. 
					
					 The buses carrying them went through the streets of the capital full of flowers of welcome. 
					
					 Citizens warmly congratulated them, waving flags of the DPRK, red flags and bouquets.

articles.title: Developers of Rocket Hwasong-12 Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Developers of Rocket Hwasong-12 Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Developers of the ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12 visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Thursday. 
					 They laid bouquets before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Waterway Project Builders Commended
articles.content:
Waterway Project Builders Commended
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Jong Il, title of DPRK labor hero, Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize, Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize and other titles of honor, orders and medals were awarded to the shock brigade members, engineers, officials and helpers in recognition of their labor feats for the first-stage gravitational waterway project in South Hwanghae Province.
					 According to the May 12 decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Order of Kim Jong Il went to Kang Mun Sok and the title of Labor Hero to Kim Chung Il, Choe Kil Jun, Jang Ryol and Ko Hyon.
					
					 And 1 578 persons received Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize, Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize, titles of Designer of Merit and Driver of Merit, Order of National Flag First Class, Order of Labour, Order of National Flag Second Class, Order of National Flag Third Class, Distinguished Military Service Medal and Medal of Merit.

articles.title: Meeting Held to Mark Anniversary of KCSWP
articles.content:
Meeting Held to Mark Anniversary of KCSWP
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held here Wednesday to mark the 43rd anniversary of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with the World People (KCSWP).
					 Present there were officials of the KCSWP, the National Peace Committee of Korea, the Democratic Lawyers Association of Korea, the Korean Committee for Afro-Asian Solidarity, the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League, the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and other social organizations and Pyongyang citizens and honorary guests.
					
					 At the meeting the reporter and speakers noted that the KCSWP has conducted brisk activities at home and abroad to defuse the tension on the Korean peninsula and achieve the independent reunification of the country over the past years.
					
					 They denounced the U.S. and its followers for their recent vicious anti-DPRK moves pushing the situation of the peninsula to the worst phase.
					
					 They called upon the progressives of the world, international democratic organizations, committees for supporting the reunification of Korea and solidarity organizations that love independence, justice and peace to resolutely reject the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and turn out in the vigorous struggle for peace and security of the Korean peninsula, Northeast Asia and the rest of the world and the prosperity common to mankind.
					
					 At the end of the meeting, the participants looked round photos introducing the activities of the KCSWP.

articles.title: Project for Building Tanchon Power Station Starts
articles.content:
Project for Building Tanchon Power Station Starts
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The Tanchon Power Station is to be built in the DPRK.
					 To build the power station, lifelong intention and behest of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, is a grand nature-remaking project that requires the construction of hundreds of kms of waterway tunnel and main dykes and power stations for making effective use of water in several rivers.
					
					 A ground-breaking ceremony for the project took place on Thursday.
					
					 Present there were Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and premier of the Cabinet, O Su Yong, vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Kim Song Il, chairman of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Ri Sang Won, chairman of the Ryanggang Provincial Committee of the WPK, and officials of armed forces organs and concerned.
					
					 Addressing the ceremony, Park Pong Ju said that the project will show the stamina of Juche Korea more vigorously advancing despite the harsh sanctions and blockade of the U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces.
					
					 The construction of large-scale Tanchon Power Station will help settle the nation's acute shortage of electricity and speed up the building of a socialist economic power and provide the people with happy material and cultural life as well as wealth impeccable in the distant future, he stressed.
					
					 He called for giving full play again to the might and spirit of the army and people closely rallied around the WPK in building the power station with self-reliance and self-development as the great dynamic force.
					
					 Resolution speeches were made.
					
					 Then, the builders started the project according to the order of Pak Pong Ju for blasting.

articles.title: National Industrial Art Exhibition Closes
articles.content:
National Industrial Art Exhibition Closes
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- A national industrial art exhibition closed with due ceremony at the National Industrial Art Exhibition House on Thursday. It was opened on April 6 to celebrate the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Exhibited there were more than 2,400 designs guided by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and over 1,500 productions, models, photos and video clips made by creative workers, teachers, researchers and students of the Central Industrial Design Administration, industrial art studios under ministries and national institutions and the education field including Pyongyang University of Fine Arts, and fans.

articles.title: Great Event for Securing Peace and Stability in Korean Peninsula and Region
articles.content:
Great Event for Securing Peace and Stability in Korean Peninsula and Region
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- All the people of the DPRK send warm congratulations to defence scientists and technicians for successfully conducting a test-fire of ground-to-ground med- to-long-range missile Hwasong-12 to demonstrate the dignity and stamina of the Korean nation all over the world.
					 They regard the successful test-fire as a historic great event that served as a sledgehammer to punish the U.S. and its followers and made a contribution to securing peace and stability in the Korean peninsula and the region.
					
					 Hong Sun Phyo, a workshop head of the Chollima Steel Complex, said:
					
					 Defence scientists and technicians developed the Korean-style "Juche weapon" and thus shatter the daydream of the imperialists keen on arbitrary practices against the DPRK and demonstrated the great might of the Songun (military first) Korea.
					
					 They are pioneers of the Mallima movement who dedicated their all to the development of Hwasong-12 with the faith to absolutely believe in and follow respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and in the spirit of devotedly carrying out the tasks set by the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 We, workers of the complex, will remarkably boost the production of Juche iron, steel and rolled steel by emulating their spirit.
					
					 Son Hyon Chol, chief engineer of the Pyongyang Condiments Factory, said:
					
					 I am very pleased to hear the news about the successful test-fire carried out under the guidance of the respected Supreme Leader and convinced that we can make a strict control the U.S.
					
					 The possession of "Juche weapon" is the greatest victory in the centuries-long confrontation with the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 With a pride of being a citizen of Juche Korea, a nuclear power in the East and a rocket launching power possessed of "Juche weapon" capable of carrying a large-size heavy nuclear warhead, I will develop and produce more condiments to improve the people's diet.

articles.title: Mushroom Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Mushroom Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Mushroom cultivation gains momentum by factories, industrial establishments, cooperative farms and even families in the DPRK. 
					 And a number of mushroom factories have been built in different parts of the country to be conducive to improving the people's diet.
					
					 The most popular among varieties of mushrooms under cultivation are pleurotus, Agaricus bisporus, Lentinus edodes, Auricularia auricular, Flammulina velutipes and Volvariella volvacea.

articles.title: Fascist Dictators of S. Korea Are Sure to Pay for their Crimes: Papers
articles.content:
Fascist Dictators of S. Korea Are Sure to Pay for their Crimes: Papers
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK leading newspapers Thursday observe the 37th anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising in south Korea.
					 On May 17, 1980, the Chun Doo Hwan junta declared "martial law-10" to ban all assemblies and political activities, shut down all universities and apply a strict pre-censorship system on the media. And it arrested lots of youth and students and democratic personages of various circles at night of May 17 and at dawn of the next day. The May 17 fascist rampage was a great fascist rowdyism heralding the start of new dictatorship in south Korea and another plot to seize "power".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun in an article notes that the youth and students and citizens in Kwangju staged a popular uprising on May 18, 1980, enraged at the reckless moves of the military gangsters who challenged, with the May 17 fascist rampage, the south Korean people's desire for democracy, under the backstage manipulation of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The article says:
					
					 Nearly 40 years have passed since the uprising, but the wishes of the south Korean people to live in an independent and democratic society and a reunified country have not yet come true.
					
					 It is entirely due to the U.S. which has dominated south Korea as its colony and the puppet group of traitors who has thoroughly trampled down the desire and aspiration of the people, pursuant to the U.S. policy.
					
					 After coming to power, traitor Park Geun Hye had brought the south Korean people to bottomless abyss of misfortune and sufferings and turned south Korea into a graveyard of democracy and a human slaughterhouse by reviving her father's "yusin" dictatorial system and enforcing the fascist rule surpassing the predecessors.
					
					 History never pardons the traitors who ran amuck for the fascist dictatorial rule in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					 Minju Joson in an article says that traitor Park and her stooges are a group of fascist gangsters and a horde of hideous man-killers surpassing the "yusin" dictator, who seized power through May 16 military coup, and the military gangsters who mercilessly suppressed the Kwangju Popular Uprising with tanks and armored cars.

articles.title: S. Koreans Demand Halt to Anti-DPRK Moves and THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Koreans Demand Halt to Anti-DPRK Moves and THAAD Deployment
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of south Korea, including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, reportedly held a rally outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on May 16, demanding prompt stop to THAAD deployment and withdrawal of its equipment and halt to anti-DPRK sanctions.
					 Speakers at the rally contended that the settlement of the THAAD issue is to what the new "government" of south Korea should give top priority and that the U.S. should stop sanctions and pressure on the north.

articles.title: Social Reforms Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Social Reforms Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The People's Emergency Action to Force the Park Geun Hye Regime to Step Down called for achieving social reforms with the strength of candlelight that overturned the corrupt regime, according to the south Korean online paper Jaju Sibo on May 11.
					 The organization said that the first task of the new "government" is to clean up the evils, and demanded probe into the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster and punishment of those responsible for the death of peasant Paek Nam Gi.
					
					 It stated that it would stage a struggle in plaza any time, if necessary to build a new society.

articles.title: Chongryon Calls for Nation-wide Struggle to Usher in Second June 15 Era
articles.content:
Chongryon Calls for Nation-wide Struggle to Usher in Second June 15 Era
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) Wednesday issued an appeal to all Koreans in Japan on the lapse of 11 years since the publication of the May 17 joint statement.
					 The appeal recalled that on May 17, 2006, representatives of Chongryon and the south Korean Residents Association issued a joint statement reflecting their joint will to put an end to the antipathy and confrontation between the two organizations and contribute to the reunification and prosperity of the country and unity of the Korean community by getting reconciled and harmony.
					
					 Now is the time for all Koreans in Japan to turn out for the unity of the Korean community and national reunification, the cherished desire of the nation, enshrining the spirit of the May 17 joint statement, the appeal said.
					
					 It called upon all Koreans to turn out as one in the nation-wide struggle to usher in the great avenue to independent reunification and the second June 15 era.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by DR Congo
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo posted on its internet homepage the full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Correctly Analyzing and Reviewing the History of Revolutionary Ideology of the Preceding Working Class" on April 29.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Media Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Media Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries gave special write-ups to the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Angolan paper O Pais told about the feats performed by Kim Il Sung to develop the DPRK into a socialist state independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 The President had enjoyed a special prestige in the world politics for his great feats for the human cause of independence, the paper stressed.
					
					  Sun Rise of Uganda, Uhuru of Tanzania, La Prosperite of DR Congo and Vea of Venezuela carried what international community has said, praising the President as peerless elder statesman.
					
					 The Egyptian paper Al Ahrar introduced in detail the devoted life of the President who reliably protected the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation by leading the two revolutionary wars to victory and dedicated his all to the happiness of the people.
					
					 The Mozambican paper Noticias dealt with the noble life of the President devoted to the liberation of Korea, freedom and happiness of the people, socialist construction and the cause of global independence. 
					
					 The Zambian paper Brand Line News and the Ethiopian paper Reporter told about the facts that party and state leaders and prominent personages of many countries had been deeply moved at the noble virtues and personality of the President.

articles.title: Anniversary of KPA Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of KPA Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, May 18 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to celebrate the 85th anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 Meetings, seminars, photo exhibitions, lectures, film shows and receptions were held in Germany, Romania, Hungary, Moldova, Bulgaria, Poland, Austria, Spain, Bangladesh, Tanzania, Nigeria, Egypt, Uganda and Ecuador between April 18 and 25.
					
					 Displayed at their venues were photos showing the leadership feats of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un for army building.
					
					 The participants watched such Korean films as "Military Parade and Public Procession of Pyongyang Citizens Held in Celebration of the 105th Birth Anniversary of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" and "Arms of Korea".
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said that Kim Il Sung founded the KPA, the genuine people's army, 85 years ago and that under his leadership, the KPA could defeat the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and fully discharge its mission and duty as the army of the people in socialist construction.
					
					 The chairman of the Hungarian Workers' Party and personages of the Tradition Association of the Polish People's Army and the Youth Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Formed in Austria praised the great leaders' feats for the foundation and strengthening of the Korean revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 The chairman of the Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups stressed that Kim Il Sung, the founder of the KPA, is a prominent military strategist and an ever-victorious iron-willed commander.

articles.title: Director de MINREX de RPDC se reune con secretaria de Estado para RR.EE. de Suecia
articles.content:
Director de MINREX de RPDC se reune con secretaria de Estado para RR.EE. de Suecia
Pyongyang, 18 de mayo (ACNC) -- El titular de la Direccion no. 2 de Europa del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Son Gyong, departio el dia 16 en Estocolmo con la secretaria de Estado para Relaciones Exteriores de Suecia, Annika Soder.
					La parte coreana informo la posicion de principios de la RPDC de desarrollar mas las relaciones entre los dos paises y enfatizo que para relajar la tensa situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y asegurar la paz y estabilidad de la region, deben ser eliminadas la amenaza nuclear y la politica de hostilidad de EE.UU. contra la RPDC. 
					
					La parte sueca senalo que su pais, que tiene las relaciones de larga historia con la RPDC, se ha esforzado constantemente por hacer aporte al desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales y a la preservacion de la paz y seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Expuso la posicion de seguir esforzandose en el futuro tambien por el desarrollo de los vinculos entre los dos paises. 
					
					Expreso gran preocupacion por la agravacion extremada de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana e insistio en que la solucion pacifica mediante el dialogo sera el unico remedio para aliviar la tension.

articles.title: CRN exalta el espiritu de lucha de martires de Levantamiento Popular de Kwangju
articles.content:
CRN exalta el espiritu de lucha de martires de Levantamiento Popular de Kwangju
Pyongyang, 18 de mayo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 37o aniversario del Levantamiento Popular de Kwangju en el Sur de Corea, el portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional hizo publica el dia 18 una declaracion.
					El Levantamiento Popular de Kwangju fue una rebelion armada masiva y sublevacion democratica antiyanqui y antifascista, senala la nota y continua:
					
					Los rebeldes de aquel entonces lucharon contra la dictadura fascista militar colonial de los imperialistas norteamericanos y sus lacayos y por la independencia y democracia de la sociedad surcoreana y la reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					Acabar con la dominacion colonial del imperialismo norteamericano que continua de siglo en siglo y eliminar completamente a las fuerzas pronorteamericanas y vendepatrias es el unanime deseo de los martires de Kwangju.
					
					Los habitantes de diferentes estratos del Sur de Corea deben dinamizar la lucha por eliminar a la horda de pronorteamericanos y fascistas acostumbrados al servilismo a grandes potencias, la traicion a la patria, la dictadura y el homicidio, con el espiritu de la lucha con velas encendidas con la cual sentencio la destruccion vergonzosa a la banda traidora de Park Geun-hye. 
					
					En particular, hay que condenar a la horca al traidor Chun Doo Hwan y otros asesinos connotados que encubren el verdadero aspecto de la masacre de Kwangju y se desesperan para mantener su vida precaria y sepultar a todos los complices de Park Geun-hye que hacen ultimos esfuerzos por dar marcha atras a las ruedas de la historia hacia la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion. 
					
					Sin acabar con la dominacion colonial de EE.UU., se agrandaran mas los sufrimientos y desgracias de la poblacion surcoreana y no se lograra nunca el deseo de los rebeldes de Kwangju. 
					
					Hace falta dinamizar la sagrada lucha pannacional para expulsar a los invasores norteamericanos y forjar por propia cuenta el destino de la nacion bajo la bandera de la independencia antiyanqui. 
					
					Los obreros, campesinos, jovenes, estudiantes y otros habitantes del Sur de Corea deben avivar mas las llamas de la lucha por la independencia antiyanqui y anticonservadora manteniendo en mas alto la bandera de la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion, levantada por los martires de Kwangju.

articles.title: Condecorados ameritados en construccion de canal de provincia Hwanghae del Sur
articles.content:
Condecorados ameritados en construccion de canal de provincia Hwanghae del Sur
Pyongyang, 18 de mayo (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fueron otorgados la Orden Kim Jong Il, el titulo de Heroe del Trabajo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Il Sung, el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Jong Il, los titulos honorarios, ordenes y medallas a los brigadistas, tecnicos, funcionarios y voluntarios quienes hicieron los meritos laborales en la construccion de la primera etapa de canal de la provincia Hwanghae del Sur.
					Segun el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, publicado el dia 12, fueron otorgados la Orden Kim Jong Il a Kang Mun Sok y el titulo de Heroe del Trabajo de la RPDC a Kim Chung Il, Choe Kil Jun, Jang Ryol y Ko Hyon.
					
					Ademas, fueron concedidos a mil 578 personas el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Il Sung, el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Jong Il, el titulo de Disenador Benemerito, el de Chofer Benemerito, la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase, la Orden del Trabajo, las Ordenes Bandera Nacional de segunda y tercera clases, la Medalla del Merito Militar y la Medalla del Merito Laboral.

articles.title: Comite de Solidaridad con Pueblos del Mundo celebra 43o aniversario de fundacion
articles.content:
Comite de Solidaridad con Pueblos del Mundo celebra 43o aniversario de fundacion
Pyongyang, 18 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 17 en esta capital el acto conmemorativo del 43o aniversario de la fundacion del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con los Pueblos del Mundo.
					Participaron en la ocasion los funcionarios del comite mencionado, el Comite Nacional Coreano por la Defensa de la Paz, la Asociacion de Juristas Democraticos de Corea, el Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con los Pueblos Afro-Asiaticos, la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista, la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea y otras entidades sociales, los capitalinos y los huespedes honorarios.
					
					En el acto hubo informe y discursos. 
					
					Los oradores dijeron que anteriormente, el Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con los Pueblos del Mundo ha desarrollado dentro y fuera del pais dinamicas actividades para aliviar la tension de la Peninsula Coreana y lograr la reunificacion independiente de la patria. 
					
					Denunciaron la campana intrigante anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y sus satelites que llevan la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana a la peor crisis. 
					
					Exhortaron a las personalidades progresistas del mundo amantes de la independencia, la justicia y la paz, las entidades democraticas internacionales y los comites de solidaridad y de apoyo a la reunificacion de Corea que rechacen la politica hostil a la RPDC de EE.UU. y se levanten en la lucha por la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico y por la prosperidad comun de la humanidad. 
					
					Terminado el acto, los participantes vieron las fotos que dan a conocer las actividades de la entidad solidaria.
